text.section:
An applicant is entitled to receive the driver's license applied for if the applicant:
Passes the examination provided for in this subtitle;
Surrenders the last learner's instructional permit issued to him, if any; and
Pays the fees provided for by this subtitle.

section.section: This subsection applies to an applicant who holds a provisional license under § 16-111 of this subtitle.
Each license issued by the Administration shall be identified clearly as to its specific class. A Class M license may be issued in combination with any one of the other classes.
The Administration shall assign an identifying number to each license it issues.
The Administration may not use, include, or encode, in any form, an individual's Social Security number on the individual's driver's license.
Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, each noncommercial Class A, B, C, or M license issued by the Administration shall be of the size, design, and content that the Administration specifies.
A license is not valid unless the licensee signs the license in the licensee's usual signature.
When issued and signed, a driver's license authorizes the licensee to drive any vehicle of the type or class specified on it, subject to any restrictions endorsed on the license.
Only one current driver's license may be issued by the Administration to and held by any individual at any one time.
Before issuing a license, the Administration shall require the applicant to surrender any license issued to the applicant by any other jurisdiction.
